KPK Soroti Gas Melon hingga BPJS Kesehatan
04 Nov 2019, 05:42 by M Rosseno Aji, Amirullah
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi (KPK) meminta Kementerian Sosial membenahi data penduduk miskin di Indonesia. Pendataan yang lebih baik memungkinkan efisiensi anggaran dan penyaluran subsidi yang lebih tepat sasaran. Hal itu disampaikan Ketua KPK Agus Rahardjo seusai bertemu Menteri Sosial Juliari Batubara di Gedung KPK.
“Kami sangat menginginkan dalam waktu cepat pemerintah bisa mempunyai data yang akurat tentang penduduk miskin,” kata Agus Rahardjo di depan kantornya, Jakarta, Senin, 4 November 2019.
Agus mengatakan gara-gara data penduduk miskin yang tidak akurat, subsidi gas ukuran tiga kilogram jadi tidak tepat sasaran. Menurut data KPK, ada 77 ton gas subsidi justru dinikmati warga tidak miskin. “Jadi tidak efisien.”
Selain itu, banyak subsidi lainnya yang juga tidak tepat sasaran, seperti subsidi pupuk, benih, bantuan pendidikan dan Badan Penyelenggara Jaminan Kesehatan. “Juga mengenai bantuan sosial, bansos itu kalau lebih akurat akan jauh lebih efisien,” ujar Agus.
Juliari mengatakan akan berkoordinasi dengan kementerian terkait untuk membenahi data yang dimiliki. Misalnya, dengan Kementerian Dalam Negeri soal data Nomor Induk Kependudukan, dan Kementerian Kesehatan selaku pengguna data terpadu kesejahteraan sosial. “Kami akan menjalankannya secara bertahap,” kata Juli.

KPK Highlights Gas Melon to Health BPJS
Nov. 04 2019, 05:42 by M Rosseno Aji, Amirullah
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) asks the Ministry of Social Affairs to fix data on the poor population in Indonesia. Better data collection enables budget efficiency and better targeted distribution of subsidies. This was said by KPK Chairman Agus Rahardjo after meeting Minister of Social Affairs Juliari Batubara at the KPK Building.
"We really want that the government can have accurate data on the poor population in a short time," Agus Rahardjo said in front of his office, Jakarta, Monday, November 4, 2019.
Agus said that because of inaccurate data on the poor population, the subsidy for three kilograms of gas was not on target. According to KPK data, there are 77 tons of subsidized gas enjoyed by non-poor residents. "So it's not efficient."
In addition, many other subsidies are also not on target, such as subsidies on fertilizers, seeds, education assistance and the Health Insurance Provider Agency. "Also regarding social assistance, the social assistance will be more efficient if it is more efficient," Agus said.
Juliari said that he would coordinate with the relevant ministries to improve the data held. For example, with the Ministry of Home Affairs concerning data on Population Registration Number, and the Ministry of Health as the integrated user of social welfare data. "We will carry it out in stages," Juli said.
